intro: Sclerostemma rupestre, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water. Sclerostemma rupestre is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. It is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
